metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10995 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mng_get_long function in coders/png.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6-0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted MNG image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10995` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> reproducer in github report mdeslaur> This is 0244-CVE-2017-10995-Fix-denial-of-service-in-mng_get_long.patch in wheezy this is 0272-CVE-2017-10995.patch in jessie

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
